alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:49AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Estill, north central Pulaski, Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 630 AM EST... At 548 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bee Lick, or 12 miles west of Mount Vernon, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ottowa, Quail, Indian Lakes Park, Bromo, Gum Sulphur and Level Green around 555 AM EST. Maretburg, Spiro, Hiatt, Wabp and Sand Springs around 600 AM EST. Mount Vernon, Muellersville, Renfro Valley, Lake Linville, Hummel, Wildie, Burr, Roundstone, Wellhope and Pine Hill around 605 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bummer, Dudley Station, Orlando, Flat Rock, Donaro, Withers, Sinks, Disputanta, Goochland, Johnetta, Loam, Cooksburg, Robinet, Threelinks, Jep Hill, Dango, Horse Lick, Ardery, Collingsworth, Eglon, Sandgap, Clover Bottom, Kerby Knob, Middlefork, Waneta, Hurley, Shop Branch, Brazil, Atkinstown, Dabolt, Alcorn, Hisel, McKee, Macedonia, Turkey Foot, Lakes, New Zion, Bradshaw, Wind Cave, Foxtown, Gray Hawk and Privett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
